conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and relationship between light source, objects, and surface.
Light source is positioned above the objects.
Objects cast shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Shadows are directly below the objects due to current position of light source.
Light source moves backward, meaning it moves away from the objects.
As light source moves farther away, angle at which light rays hit objects will change.
Shadows will move forward (towards the objects) as light source moves backward.
Size of shadows will decrease as light source moves backward.
Final answer: Shadows will shift forward and become smaller.
